CS:GO Is the only competetive FPS that I have ever stuck with and shall keep returning to...

This is for a few reasons:
- The gameplay and mechanics are the most solid and balanced in any fps game I have yet played
- Although VAC may still be a bit naff Valve has taken lots of measure to improve matchmaking and remove cheaters etc.
- Competetive matches have rarely ever given me any issues with ping, hit detection/registration etc.
- many decent skins and the crates you obtain them from are cheap and can all be traded through the community market (Unlike some games **cough cough** BLACK SQUAD!, Fuck you VALOFE!)
- Graphics are modern and kept up to date while being able to maintain high frame rates on most gaming PC's
- the game's competetive scene, player base and relevancy have held steady over the years and CS:GO shows no sign of dying any time soon

on another note:
I personally do not like FPS games with character/ability systems where the matches you play can become far too unpredictable and balancing is always a pain... In CS:GO everyone has access to the exact same weapons/grenades etc. and in my eyes this should be the gold standard for the mechanics of competetive FPS games.

В Україні з часів першого комп'ютера усі любили піратський Контру, - від часів компютерних клубів усі у неї грали по-піратськи за терористів-мусорів, але часи змінилися та я лишень жалкую що нагорода 5 років Контра лише у мене одного. Чекаю на відкат дитячих розваг зі старої системи "ГРУ людям".

Arkadaşlarınızla oynadığınız zaman genelde kd oranınız düşük olur ama oyunu oynarken inanılmaz zevk alırsınız tek başınıza oynadığınızda oynadığınızda ise kd oranı yüksek ama bir işi yapmak için yapıyormuş hissi verir
Ayrıca :    Oyunu indirip oynayacaksanız bilgisayar sisteminiz önerilenler kısmındaki gibi ve ya daha yüksek olması şart yoksa oyunu oynayamazsınız ve ya 30 fps'yi geçemezsiniz.
